site_name: The University of Arizona Animal Care

citations.narrative:
The incorrect species common name was listed in the FY 2022 annual report as Black-footed ferret (an endangered
species), whereas the actual species on hand and in use for Category D research was domestic ferret. It was determined
that research staff understood the animals to be domestic ferrets when working with them. Incorrectly identifying species
used in research on records can lead to clerical errors and misunderstanding when reporting to Congress and the
American public. On the annual report, research facilities shall state the correct common names of animals upon which
research tests were conducted involving accompanying pain or distress to the animal and for which appropriate
anesthetic, analgesic or tranquilizing drugs were used.
Correct by submitting an amended FY 2022 annual report to USDA APHIS Animal Care by 28 July 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.36(b)(6) 
   
Annual report. 
The incorrect species common name was listed in the FY 2022 annual report as Black-footed ferret (an endangered 
species), whereas the actual species on hand and in use for Category D research was domestic ferret. It was determined 
that research staff understood the animals to be domestic ferrets when working with them. Incorrectly identifying species 
used in research on records can lead to clerical errors and misunderstanding when reporting to Congress and the 
American public. On the annual report, research facilities shall state the correct common names of animals upon which 
research tests were conducted involving accompanying pain or distress to the animal and for which appropriate 
anesthetic, analgesic or tranquilizing drugs were used.  
 
Correct by submitting an amended FY 2022 annual report to USDA APHIS Animal Care by 28 July 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
